00006 // Define Matrix classes for pointers
00007 class MatrixAliasConstant;
00008 class SubMatrixAliasConstant;
00009 class MatrixAlias;
00010 class SubMatrixAlias;
00011 
00012 //! \brief Read access for matrix classes
00013 //! \author Lee Netherton
00014 //!
00015 //! The MatrixReadAccess class provides basic read operatons for the MatrixOperator
00016 //! classes, and the matrix class itself. Each matrix class will have a pointer
00017 //! to a MatrixReadAccess, or one if its derivatives.
00018 //!
00019 class MatrixReadAccess
00020 {
00021         protected:
00022 
00023                 //! Pointer to owner matrix
00024                 MatrixAliasConstant * m_matrixAliasConstant;
00025 
00026         public:
00027 
00028                 //! \brief Constructor
00029                 //!
00030                 //! Sets pointer to owner matrix
00031                 //! \param mAC Pointer to owner matrix
00032                 MatrixReadAccess(MatrixAliasConstant * mAC) : m_matrixAliasConstant(mAC)
00033                 {
00034                         #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCT
00035                                 printf("Constructor: MatrixReadAccess(MatrixAliasConstant * mAC)\n");
00036                         #endif
00037                 }
00038 
00039                 //! Returns a read-only reference to the data member at specified position
00040                 //! \param row Row position of desired element (zero indexed)
00041                 //! \param column Column position of desired element (zero indexed)
00042                 virtual const double& readElement(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column);
00043 
00044                 //! Returns a read-only reference to the data member at specified position
00045                 //! \param index Row-wise position of element (zero-indexed)
00046                 virtual const double& readElement(const unsigned int index);
00047 
00048                 //! Returns the number of rows the matrix has
00049                 const unsigned int getRows() const;
00050 
00051                 //! Returns the number of columns the matrix has
00052                 const unsigned int getColumns() const;
00053 
00054                 //! Returns the a pointer to the matrix data array
00055                 virtual const double * getDataPointer();
00056 
00057                 //! \brief Sets the data pointer
00058                 void setDataPointer(const double * data) const;
00059 
00060                 //! For flagging errors - to be depreciated.
00061                 void error(const char* str) const;
00062 };

00065 //! \brief Read access for sub-matrix classes
00066 //! \author Lee Netherton
00067 //!
00068 //! The SubMatrixReadAccess class provides basic read operatons for the MatrixOperator
00069 //! classes, and the sub matrix class itself. Each sub matrix class will have a pointer
00070 //! to a SubMatrixReadAccess.
00071 //!
00072 class SubMatrixReadAccess : public MatrixReadAccess
00073 {
00074         private:
00075 
00076                 //! Pointer to owner sub matrix
00077                 SubMatrixAliasConstant * m_subMatrixAliasConstant;
00078 
00079         public:
00080 
00081                 //! \brief Constructor
00082                 //!
00083                 //! Sets pointer to owner matrix and constructs base class.
00084                 //! \param sMAC Pointer to owner matrix
00085                 SubMatrixReadAccess(SubMatrixAliasConstant * sMAC) :
00086                         MatrixReadAccess((MatrixAliasConstant *)sMAC),
00087                         m_subMatrixAliasConstant(sMAC)
00088                         {
00089                                 #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCT
00090                                         printf("Constructor: SubMatrixReadAccess(SubMatrixAliasConstant * sMAC)\n");
00091                                 #endif
00092                         }
00093 
00094                 //! Returns a read-only reference to the data member at specified position
00095                 //! \param row Row position of desired element (zero indexed)
00096                 //! \param column Column position of desired element (zero indexed)
00097                 virtual const double& readElement(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column);
00098 
00099                 //! Returns a read-only reference to the data member at specified position
00100                 //! \param index Row-wise position of element (zero-indexed)
00101                 virtual const double& readElement(const unsigned int index);
00102 
00103                 //! \brief Returns the number of rows in the original matrix
00104                 const unsigned int getRowsOrig() const;
00105 
00106                 //! \brief Returns the number of columns in the original matrix
00107                 const unsigned int getColumnsOrig() const;
00108 
00109                 //! \brief Returns the row start position
00110                 const unsigned int getRowStart() const;
00111 
00112                 //! \brief Returns the row end position
00113                 const unsigned int getRowEnd() const;
00114 
00115                 //! \brief Returns the column start position
00116                 const unsigned int getColumnStart() const;
00117 
00118                 //! \brief Returns the column end position
00119                 const unsigned int getColumnEnd() const;
00120 
00121 };

00124 //! \brief Write access for matrix classes
00125 //! \author Lee Netherton
00126 //!
00127 //! The MatrixWriteAccess class provides basic write operatons for the MatrixWriteOperator
00128 //! classes, and the matrix class itself. Each writable matrix class will have a pointer
00129 //! to a MatrixWriteAccess, or one if its derivatives.
00130 //!
00131 class MatrixWriteAccess
00132 {
00133         protected:
00134 
00135                 //! Pointer to owner matrix
00136                 MatrixAlias * m_matrixAlias;
00137 
00138         public:
00139 
00140                 //! \brief Constructor
00141                 //!
00142                 //! Sets pointer to owner matrix
00143                 //! \param mA Pointer to owner matrix
00144                 MatrixWriteAccess(MatrixAlias * mA) : m_matrixAlias(mA)
00145                 {
00146                         #ifdef DEBUG_CONSTRUCT
00147                                 printf("Constructor: MatrixWriteAccess(MatrixAlias * mA)\n");
00148                         #endif
00149                 }
00150 
00151                 //! Returns a writable reference to the data member at specified position
00152                 //! \param row Row position of desired element (zero indexed)
00153                 //! \param column Column position of desired element (zero indexed)
00154                 virtual double& writeElement(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column);
00155 
00156                 //! Returns a writable reference to the data member at specified position
00157                 //! \param index Row-wise position of element (zero-indexed)
00158                 virtual double& writeElement(const unsigned int index);
00159 
00160                 //! Returns the number of rows the matrix has
00161                 const unsigned int getRows() const;
00162 
00163                 //! Returns the number of columns the matrix has
00164                 const unsigned int getColumns() const;
00165 
00166                 //! Returns the a pointer to the matrix data array
00167                 virtual double * getDataPointer();
00168 
00169                 //! \brief Sets the data pointer
00170                 void setDataPointer(const double * data) const;
00171 
00172                 //! \brief Sets the number of rows
00173                 void setRows(const unsigned int num) const;
00174 
00175                 //! \brief Sets the number of columns
00176                 void setColumns(const unsigned int num) const;
00177 
00178                 //! For flagging errors - to be depreciated.
00179                 void error(const char* str) const;

00181 };
